metadata.Title: CVE-2018-19961 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.11.x on AMD x86 platforms, possibly allowing guest OS users to gain host OS privileges because TLB flushes do not always occur after IOMMU mapping changes.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19961` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxencall1 - 4.11.1-1
libxendevicemodel1 - 4.11.1-1
libxenevtchn1 - 4.11.1-1
libxenforeignmemory1 - 4.11.1-1
libxengnttab1 - 4.11.1-1
libxenhypfs1 - 4.11.1-1
libxenmisc4.17 - 4.11.1-1
libxenstore4 - 4.11.1-1
libxentoolcore1 - 4.11.1-1
libxentoollog1 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.17-amd64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.17-arm64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.17-armhf - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-common - 4.11.1-1
xen-system-amd64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-system-arm64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-system-armhf - 4.11.1-1
xen-utils-4.17 - 4.11.1-1
xen-utils-common - 4.11.1-1
xenstore-utils - 4.11.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.1-1').
